docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 5 -- Uruguayan officials interested in mustering a strong pan-American front against the Axis expressed surprise and disappointment tonight at the personnel of General Arturo Rawson's new military regime in Argentina.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 5 -- Uruguayan officials interested in mustering a strong pan-American front against the Axis expressed surprise and disappointment tonight at the personnel of General Arturo Rawson's new military regime in Argentina.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan officials disappointed with Cabinet make-up

headline.main: ARGENTINE CABINET SHOCK TO URUGUAY; Officials Seeking Pan-American Front See Hopes Dimmed in Rightist-Military Make-Up

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 5 -- A new Argentine government was formed tonight by the military junta that had been in control of the nation's affairs since the successful revolution yesterday and General Arturo Rawson, leader of the march on Buenos...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 5 -- A new Argentine government was formed tonight by the military junta that had been in control of the nation's affairs since the successful revolution yesterday and General Arturo Rawson, leader of the march on Buenos Aires in the coup d'etat, became President.

headline.main: REVOLT COMPLETED; Military Leaders and 2 Civilians in Buenos Aires Government CASTILLO RESIGNS, FREED Two of His Ministers Jailed for Trial -- Pro-American Neutrality Policy Seen REVOLT COMPLETED AS CASTILLO QUITS

byline.original: By ARNALDO CORTESISpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: DETROIT, June 5 -- The unexpected death of Edsel Ford, president of the Ford Motor Company, on May 26 came as a shock to nearly every person in Detroit, but serious as was his loss to the community, it left the company and the huge family fortune...
docs.lead_paragraph: DETROIT, June 5 -- The unexpected death of Edsel Ford, president of the Ford Motor Company, on May 26 came as a shock to nearly every person in Detroit, but serious as was his loss to the community, it left the company and the huge family fortune unshaken.

headline.main: FORD EMPIRE UNSHAKEN BY THE DEATH OF EDSEL; Father Again President of Company He Never Ceased to Control

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 5 (AP) -- General Arturo Rawson, the new 59-year-old President of Argentina, is a professional soldier and has devoted most of his life to the cavalry. Likewise, General Pedro P. Ramirez, co-sponsor of the Argentine coup and...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 5 (AP) -- General Arturo Rawson, the new 59-year-old President of Argentina, is a professional soldier and has devoted most of his life to the cavalry. Likewise, General Pedro P. Ramirez, co-sponsor of the Argentine coup and who will retain his post as Minister of War in the new government, is a cavalryman and former classmate of President Rawson.

headline.main: Leaders of Argentina's New Government Cavalrymen and Army School Classmates
FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED JUNE 5, 1943

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 6 -- General Arturo Rawson's revolutionary government tonight decreed the dissolution of the Argentine Congress, and also displayed an anti-Communist character by ordering the police to suppress any Communist statements...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 6 -- General Arturo Rawson's revolutionary government tonight decreed the dissolution of the Argentine Congress, and also displayed an anti-Communist character by ordering the police to suppress any Communist statements and to close down the Communist newspaper Hora.
docs.abstract: Communist newspaper Buenos Aires Hora closed

headline.main: ARGENTINE REGIME DISBANDS CONGRESS AND COMBATS REDS; General Rawson Acts on the Eve of Taking Oath as New President

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 7 (AP) -- General Arturo Rawson of Argentina told The Associated Press late today that the international situation was the "fundamental cause" of the military uprising in that country, which he declared was "indispensable to...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 7 (AP) -- General Arturo Rawson of Argentina told The Associated Press late today that the international situation was the "fundamental cause" of the military uprising in that country, which he declared was "indispensable to save the situation and rectify the isolationist situation in which we now so unjustly find ourselves."
docs.abstract: Wash comment; Rawson stresses isolationism end; admits Rightist stand of some of his Mins; reaction, Martinique

headline.main: GEN. RAWSON STRESSES END OF ISOLATIONISM; Admits Some of His Proposed Ministers Were Too 'Rightist'

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 7 (U.P.) -- The Supreme Court of Argentina recognized the Provisional Government of President Ramirez tonight soon after he and his Cabinet members took the oaths of office.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 7 (U.P.) -- The Supreme Court of Argentina recognized the Provisional Government of President Ramirez tonight soon after he and his Cabinet members took the oaths of office.

headline.main: Shift May Be in Allies' Favor

docs.snippet: An Argentine general named Arturo Rawson heads an uprising which leads to a new Cabinet in which the Minister of War is Edelmiro and the Minister of Agriculture is Diego Mason. It is a reminder that the original English-speaking element in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: An Argentine general named Arturo Rawson heads an uprising which leads to a new Cabinet in which the Minister of War is Edelmiro and the Minister of Agriculture is Diego Mason. It is a reminder that the original English-speaking element in the southern republics of South America has counted for a great deal more than its limited numbers would suggest.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 9 (U.P.) -- Argentina's neighbor States moved swiftly to recognize her new revolutionary government tonight, forty-eight hours after President Pedro Ramirez's official bid for closer relations with the solidly anti-Axis...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, June 9 (U.P.) -- Argentina's neighbor States moved swiftly to recognize her new revolutionary government tonight, forty-eight hours after President Pedro Ramirez's official bid for closer relations with the solidly anti-Axis nations of the Western Hemisphere.

headline.main: 4 NATIONS ACCEPT ARGENTINE REGIME; Neighboring States of Brazil, Chile, Paraguay, Bolivia Accord Recognition
